trans-unit.target: TEXT_REGOTH4WERLYTGARAGE_00686_GARLONDMECHANIC00686_000_000<tab>This lift leads down to the storage area where the Weapons were kept. Unfortunately, the imperials didn't leave an awful lot behind for us to investigate, but they did give us a place to carry out maintenance on the G<var 1F /var>Warrior.

TEXT_REGOTH4WERLYTGARAGE_00686_GARLONDMECHANIC00686_000_064<tab>And speaking of racing through the sky, I understand the Anti-G armament proved a valuable asset in your last battle. A shame we had no clue it had been installed. The president was none too pleased to hear <var 1A 02 /var>that<var 1A 01 /var>, let me tell you...
TEXT_REGOTH4WERLYTGARAGE_00686_GARLONDMECHANIC00686_000_070<tab>As you can imagine, to get such an enormous machine airborne requires considerable feats of engineering.

TEXT_REGOTH4WERLYTGARAGE_00686_GARLONDMECHANIC00686_000_071<tab>We initially experimented with designs similar to those of the <var 1A 02 /var>Enterprise<var 1A 01 /var> and <var 1A 02 /var>Excelsior<var 1A 01 /var>, but we were unable to generate enough lift.

TEXT_REGOTH4WERLYTGARAGE_00686_GARLONDMECHANIC00686_000_072<tab>Fortunately, Avilina's knowledge of the propulsion engines used in Garlean airships proved to be the deciding factor. Without her, we would never have gotten the G-Savior off the ground.
TEXT_REGOTH4WERLYTGARAGE_00686_GARLONDMECHANIC00686_000_080<tab>Due to its Allagan origin, we've struggled to locate replacement parts for the G-Warrior.

TEXT_REGOTH4WERLYTGARAGE_00686_GARLONDMECHANIC00686_000_081<tab>We ended up turning to an expert in such relics, who managed not only to create perfect replicas of the required components, but even produced enough to build a second G-Warrior.

TEXT_REGOTH4WERLYTGARAGE_00686_GARLONDMECHANIC00686_000_082<tab>It then underwent the same conversion process as the original model, resulting in the G-Savior Mark II. But rather than use the familiar color scheme of Garlond Ironworks, the creator opted for something more closely aligned with his personal tastes...

TEXT_REGOTH4WERLYTGARAGE_00686_GARLONDMECHANIC00686_000_083<tab>I feared the worst when Procopius made off with it, so I'm very much relieved to see the Mark II returned─though it admittedly has a few more scrapes than I'd like.

TEXT_REGOTH4WERLYTGARAGE_00686_GARLONDMECHANIC00686_000_090<tab>The primary function of the G-Savior Mark II is to increase the strength of the containment field by combining its generator with that of the original unit.

TEXT_REGOTH4WERLYTGARAGE_00686_GARLONDMECHANIC00686_000_100<tab>As the design is based on the original unit, it offers the same amount of propulsion. The only trouble with using both G-Saviors at once is that we end up burning through twice the amount of fuel. If you were wondering why we don't deploy them more often, you need only look at the running costs...
